I decided to backpack Vietnam for a few weeks. It was the funnest decision of my life so far. I was initially going to budget travel as cheaply as possible, but then I thought,  - When are you ever going to be here again? - You never know where life will take you.  Any of us could die tomorrow.But after a couple of slow, boring trips on buses, and a failed motorcycle taxi experience where the bloke dropped me off forty minutes from the right address and made me miss church, I thought,  - Screw this.  Walking is for peasants. -  - So I messaged Lee that night and rented a motorcycle from him the next morning.  He - s so nice and helpful and is wonderfully responsive if you have any questions or need help.  I can - t even explain how I feel weaving through 15 lanes of logical chaos in a Vietnamese intersection at night; it - s like flying.  I can - t remember a single day since I found my mum dead where I have been this happy or this free. It felt like living in a real-life video game where there are no cops and you literally can - t do anything wrong.  - Not advice, just sayin - ... -  -  -   There are plenty of police, it only  - felt -  like there weren - t.  After barely surviving the most abusive year of my life last year that nearly killed me, this was the best decision I - ve made in a long time... Every day I wake up grateful that God made a way and allowed me to do something so beautiful and healing. A few months ago I had zero money and no way to go, and then  suddenly I did, so I took a chance and went.  On a motorbike, I was able to see and experience more  of Vietnam than I ever imagined  and now I will smile about these memories the rest of my life.   - Read more
